meanings.sent1: The tiny ant tried to overmaster the large crumb.
meanings.sent2: The superhero was able to overmaster the villain's evil plan.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to overmaster the bird in a nut-gathering competition.
meanings.sent4: The waves overmastered the sandcastle, washing it away.
meanings.sent5: The determined student overmastered the difficult math problem after hours of practice.

meanings.definition: To gain control or dominance over
meanings.sent1: The queen bee sought to overmaster the hive and its inhabitants.
meanings.sent2: The dictator aimed to overmaster the entire country with his oppressive rule.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to overmaster the dog's favorite sleeping spot.
meanings.sent4: The darkness seemed to overmaster the room, engulfing everything in shadows.
meanings.sent5: The skilled chess player managed to overmaster his opponent in every match.

meanings.definition: To be superior to or surpass in strength or ability
meanings.sent1: The champion boxer was able to overmaster all his opponents in the ring.
meanings.sent2: The new technology aimed to overmaster the previous models in efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The sun seemed to overmaster the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed overmastered any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The lion's roar overmastered all other sounds in the jungle, asserting its dominance.
